keyword: how many calories in three scrambled eggs
title: How Many Calories Are in Three Scrambled Eggs?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in three scrambled eggs, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Three Scrambled Eggs?
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), scrambled with 1 tsp butter total, no added salt, milk, or cheese.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, cooking method, and ingredients like milk or seasonings. Check recipes or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Three large scrambled eggs provide ~273 kcal and ~18 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories per scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 91 kcal for one large scrambled egg with minimal butter.

faqs.q: What are the macros for three scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: â‰ˆ18 g protein, 20 g fat, 1.5 g carbs.

faqs.q: Do scrambled eggs have more calories than boiled?
faqs.a: Yes, due to added butter or oil; boiled are ~78 kcal per egg.

faqs.q: How does adding milk affect calories in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Adds ~5 kcal per tbsp per egg, plus minor protein and carbs.

faqs.q: Why is cholesterol high in three scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Eggs are naturally high; three provide ~600 mg, mostly in yolks.
